S

Security - Class in com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp
 
Security() - Constructor for class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Security
 
send(Object) - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Client
Sends the specified object to the server in XML format
send(Object) - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Connection
Sends the specified Object to the peer which the socket is connected to
Server - Class in com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp
This class creates a TCP server in which Clients can connect to
The class uses XML to serialize the data sent
Server() - Constructor for class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Server
Creates an unbound Server
Server(int) - Constructor for class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Server
Creates a Server bound to the specified port
ServerListener - Interface in com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp
This interface defines a ServerListener.onDisconnect(Connection) method, a ServerListener.onReceive(Connection, Object) method, and a ServerListener.onConnect(Connection) method
The ServerListener.onDisconnect(Connection) method is called when a Client disconnects from the Server and
the method ServerListener.onReceive(Connection, Object) is called when an object is received from a Client and
the method ServerListener.onConnect(Connection) is called when a Client connects to the Server .
setId(int) - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Connection
Sets the id of the connection so as to distinguish from other connections
If this method was never called the id will be -1
start() - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Client
Starts the clients socket and starts receiving from it.
start() - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Server
Starts the Server
If wanting to run other processes this should be called in a thread as it will run infinitely until the Server.stop() method is invoked
stop() - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Client
Stops the clients socket and the input and output streams.
stop() - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Connection
 
stop() - Method in class com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Server
Starts the Server
If wanting to run other processes this should be called in a thread as it will run infinitely until the Server.stop() method is invoked
